attributes.action: Put a limit on when HGV's and Tractors can access Main Roads and Motorways
attributes.background: During "rush hour" periods 0700-0900 and 1700-1900, HGV's and Tractors should not be allowed on Main Roads or Motorways due to the fact that they make every journey longer.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of collisions and spillages on roads especially Motorways involve a HGV during busy periods, This leads to severe delays and road closures impacting the remaining 99% of road travellers time at home. 
By limiting the times to which they can travel the rush hour periods should run more smoothly allowing traffic to flow with less accidents

attributes.action: Abolish PMQs and replace with legal requirement to attend select committees.
attributes.background: PMQs no longer serve any useful constitutional purpose. The weekly event has desended into nothing more than political pantomime. Instead to enforce proper democratic accountability the PM should be obliged to attend the Home, foreign and treasury select committee for an hour each per month.

attributes.action: Up the fine for driving using a mobile to six points off license and £500.
attributes.background: Everyday I see dozens of drivers flouting this law and families are wrecked as a result. The present penalties are woefully inadequate and provide very little deterrent.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Poultry Manure being spread on fields for agricultural use.
attributes.background: Over the past several years Poultry Manure has been introduced rather than Cow manure on agricultural land. If the wind is blowing just slightly, then you can't go outside the house without the nauseating and gut-wrenching smell that comes off the Manure.

attributes.action: Enable Police and Telephone services to trace and prosecute cold callers.
attributes.background: Cold calling is supposed to be illegal, TPS is not a deterrent, so the Police, trading Standards and Telephone service providers should be compelled to cooperate to trace, arrest, and prosecute offenders. A help line should be created for reporting offending numbers.
attributes.additional_details: In this digital world, it should be possible to trace who purchased any number. Citizens can bar withheld numbers to prevent some calls, but there is a problem with normal numbers. These must be held on record by service providers. They must be traceable to a specific location.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for data companies to sell any personal data to any third party.
attributes.background: I receive in the region of 10-15 cold-calls every day. These calls cannot currently be blocked by BT and are only subject to Telephone Preference if made within the UK.
attributes.additional_details: If these calls were being made within the UK, and assuming that the person receiving them has signed up to TPS, then the company making the call could be prosecuted, as could the company who sold the data, because they had not made the required checks against the TPS data base. Unfortunately, this does not apply to overseas call centres. However, if the companies that sell this data were closed down, eventually the problem would stop.

attributes.action: Provide statistical report of areas / numbers of culled badgers hosting TB.
attributes.background: The Government failed to test culled badgers to measure the percentage hosting tuberculosis & the most affected areas.  This data is key. UK Government ignored advice of Wildlife Experts by continuing the Badger cull. Other wildlife such as Deer host TB, so the badger cull policy is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all efforts by wildlife experts to stop the badger cull the Government continues with a badly devised scheme to reduce TB.  The most important data was never obtained. Recording the number of affected culled badgers and the areas where TB was most prevalent is surely crucial for developing a strategy to reduce Bovine TB.  A statistical report will show where number of TB hosts are more severe.  Joined up interventions such as vaccinations and bio-security on farms are needed.

attributes.action: Give college/sixth form students loans just like university students
attributes.background: Many people can not attend college sometimes due to not being able to afford things like the bus or metro, and not everybody is eligible for the bursary. However, the bursary is not enough for some people, for example £14 a week can not cover a £20 weekly bus pass.
attributes.additional_details: In addition, many students struggle to buy things such as notebooks and pens and textbooks needed to study. How is it fair that uni students can get loans yet we can't? We would pay it back once we completed studies and got jobs; it's very hard for a 16/17 year old to get a job these days especially without experience. It is very hard to get a job to support ourselves whilst studying a levels- it is simply too stressful which could effect our results and futures.

attributes.action: Introduce Mobile phone jammers into prisons to stop prisoners taunting victims
attributes.background: There has been an increase in prisoners taunting victims, intimidating witnesses and accessing social media. Introducing mobile phone jammers into prisons would rectify this with the flick of a button.
attributes.additional_details: The Secretary of state for justice needs to introduce Mobile phone jammers which would stop all prisoners accessing the internet via smart phones and making calls.

attributes.action: Abolish the wasteful Brexit (Exiting the EU) and International Trade Departments
attributes.background: These departments replicate functions of the existing Foreign and Cabinet Offices and Business Department. They're wasteful and disruptive, serving no useful function. Britain's governing party and its squabbling ministers should settle their differences over Europe internally not at public expense.
attributes.additional_details:
https://twitter.com/lewiscoughlan/status/764377677038030848

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/hiring-brexit-experts-will-cost-billions-khn6mw3j2

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/13/liam-fox-and-boris-johnson-locked-in-feud-over-who-controls-brit/

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3749965/ANDREW-PIERCE-longer-Theresa-tolerate-three-backstabbing-Brexiteers.html

attributes.action: Charge those who misuse public services through drink or drug abuse.
attributes.background: Charge those who misuse public services, such as the ambulance service, police, fire service or the NHS, through drink or drug abuse. Use the money raised through these charges to improve those services, funding things like cancer research, police on the streets, keep hospitals open.
attributes.additional_details:
An article from The Telegraph in 2015 in reference to the government looking into the cost of obesity, drug abuse and alcoholism to the UK economy.

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/health/news/11769531/Cost-of-obesity-drug-abuse-and-alcoholism-to-be-revealed.html

attributes.action: Except for MP salary. 100% tax on all other incomes for UK politicians.
attributes.background: Put 100% tax on all external to post income for all UK politicians including offshore investments and holdings. Prevent income and/or wealth transfers for a year prior to position. Ban a time offset for potential missed outside earnings. Ban employment post role in associated industry for 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Except for MP salary. Put 100% tax on all income for all UK politicians including offshore investments and holdings. 

To discourage people from becoming MPs for financial gain.

To encourage future MPs to consider their country the primary reason for taking a political post.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to exclude Legal Expenses cover against Financial Institutions
attributes.background: Family legal expenses policies commonly sold by insurance companies as an add on for about £30 specifically exclude taking any legal action against any insurance company or bank for any insurance contract, savings, pension or investment policy. This should be outlawed as an unfair contract condition
attributes.additional_details: The insurance industry has created a self protection society to the consumer's detriment. The Government has heavily criticised the FCA and the Ombudsman they created and often reach a decisions different to the law. The consumer is at their mercy as without legal expenses cover they can't afford to take action against arrogant, big boy bully insurance providers who just tell the consumer to go away. These policies are consequently worthless in this regard one of the biggest industries in the UK

attributes.action: Have a referendum on health and social welfare funding for the next generation.
attributes.background: Health and social welfare funding is a subject very dear to voters but one whose effects run longer than the lives of any Parliament, or the careers of many Civil Servants or politicians.  Whether the UK has a US or Scandinavian model for health and social provision should be subject to plebiscite.
attributes.additional_details: I am a hospital consultant and fellow of the Royal College of Physicians, and feel that this is one of the bigger issues of relevance to people currently, and one which is not adequately exposed or debated within the short lives of Parliaments.

attributes.action: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people
attributes.background: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people. The law must prevent any waiver of liability and subject media companies to strict liability conditions. A special type of warrant must should be available and the ability to subpoena witnesses for the defence.
attributes.additional_details:
Media exploits individuals in reality shows we need a law to protect people, this includes Shilpa Shetty who was subjected to racist abuse on Big Brother, Patrick Dauncey fell from a cliff in The Island, Jacintha Saldanha committed suicide after a telephone prank & Ajwinder Bains in his Truman Show rip-off

All these people have suffered horrific manipulation and it gets worse each year. It is time for Parliament to act, to deal with this increasing problem. There should be high punitive damages

attributes.action: I want a ban on Guns Knives Machetes Swords and other dangerous items.
attributes.background: Guns Knives Machetes Swords are sold openly at Car Boots Sales. We are in a climate where an attack on civilians could happen at any time and in any area. Legislation should be put in place to prevent this practice from continuing.

attributes.action: Stop South Africans voting in UK when Brits can't vote in SA.
attributes.background:
A Brit living in South Africa with permanent residency is prevented from voting in South African elections. However, South Africans can move to the UK and after meeting the residency requirements can vote in all UK elections.
This is grossly unjust and needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Qualifying Commonwealth citizens can vote in all UK elections once they've been resident for the requisite period but in some Commonwealth countries like South Africa there is no reciprocal agreement. This is blatantly unfair and unjust and must be stopped.

Who can vote in a South African election?
http://www.elections.org.za/content/For-Voters/FAQ--Voter-registration/

Who can vote in a UK election?
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/faq/voting-and-registration/who-is-eligible-to-vote-at-a-uk-general-election

Qualifying Commonwealth citizens: http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/electoral_commission_pdf_file/0009/79515/List-of-eligible-countries.pdf

attributes.action: Call for a Ban on the Industrial Manufacture of Honey in the UK
attributes.background:
Current methods cause massive unnecessary slaughter of Bees. Bees are vital to our survival and to maintaining our delicate eco systems
Unnatural methods used by industrial beekeepers, such as A.I, antibiotics, clipping a Queen Bee's wings are wholly unacceptable
All to satisfy corporate greed
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/GreenWorldTVUK/videos/1623198151304386/?__mref=message

attributes.action: Limit the cost of mandatory insurance policies, i.e. motor insurance.
attributes.background: It is immoral to charge people inflated premiums when it is the law to ensure you have the insurance in place.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies use statistics to seperate and ultimately increase charges applied to different parts of the population. More specifically it should be illegal to increase the motor insurance of someone for having an accident which wasn't their fault. If your no claims bonus had increased your premium must drop.

attributes.action: Ban personal and commercial drone flights over residential properties
attributes.background: ​Following the recent approval from The Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) granted to Amazon to test its aerial vehicles without several of the flying restrictions rules, we the undersigned seek to ban all drone flights at any height over residential properties and privately owned land.
attributes.additional_details: With the usage of drones by hobbyists, individuals and organisations on the increase we are concerned that privacy will be compromised, and catching any offenders will be near impossible. The risk of harm through drone faults will increase. Drones will be used by criminals to spy and transport illegal items. Noise pollution will increase and it will no doubt cause many homeowners to feel uncomfortable & insecure in their own back garden.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for youth clubs across the UK.
attributes.background: Many people have little awareness about the issues that face young people. Youth clubs support ANYONE in issues they face and help them tackle them but also enjoy themselves. However, there is little awareness, funding or volunteers to help support them so we want the government to increase funding.
attributes.additional_details: The importance of youth clubs go unnoticed, they help thousands of young people get out and meet new people. They relieve built up stress and help with issues that can affect mental health. By raising the funds it allows more young people to be involved in society and make a positive impact towards the community.

attributes.action: Stop NHS healthcare surcharge as part of Non-EU immigration application.
attributes.background: Non-EEA nationals applying for UK visa applications are required to pay significant additional costs in relation to their applications. This is due to the introduction of a health surcharge to cover the costs of the migrant’s use of the NHS while in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
Non-EEA nationals applying for UK visa applications are required to pay significant additional costs in relation to their applications. This is due to the introduction of a health surcharge to cover the costs of the migrant’s use of the NHS while in the United Kingdom.
The amount of the surcharge is as follows:
£200 per year for all migrants except:
Tier 4 students who will pay £150 per year

attributes.action: Debate the sale of ARM Holdings to Softbank
attributes.background: ARM Holdings is a British success story, they design chip architecture for a vast proportion of the smartphones that we all use daily. Is this a good deal for the UK or just another highly leveraged sell off of a great company.

attributes.action: Make it a regulation that support staff have a decent bed when on sleep ins
attributes.background:
I have worked in the care sector for years now and have a spinal disc hernia and arthritis in my back.
This I'm sure is caused by unsuitable cheap beds that support staff sleep on several times a week, care staff are known to have back problems in later life cheap beds are a huge contribution.

attributes.action: Extend basic rate gift aid to all donations made by private individuals.
attributes.background: Gift aid is allowable on donations by UK taxpayers. Donations made by non taxpayers, which are often a larger proportion of their income should be encouraged by the government. This small gesture would do so at little cost to the exchequer.

attributes.action: Make the title nutritionist protected
attributes.background: there are many people out there that call them selfs a Nutritionist  however quite a few of them do not hold any degree that gives them the right to be called one let alone to work as one, some people tend to do a few day course which  this will allow them to give nutrition advice out to people
attributes.additional_details:
due to these few days  courses  which people do this causes a knock on effect on our jobs as a nutritionist also this puts people health at risk due to the advice that gets given is incorrect on a few accounts. 

make our title protected like the dietetics is protected

attributes.action: Condemn dismissal of judges by Turkish authorities following military coup
attributes.background: Turkish authorities have reacted to the military coup by dismissing nearly 3000 judges around the country. This is a clear victimisation of members of the legal profession and is a disproportionate measure which will impact on administration of justice.

attributes.action: Reinstate the SKILLED MIGRANT VISA to allow commonwealth citizens to work here
attributes.background: For too long COMMONWEALTH citizens (AUS/NZ/CAN etc) have been denied the necessary VISA to come and work in the UK,  denying the UK access to their skills, knowledge and innovation. This is now more necessary than ever in a BREXIT world, and the UK needs to maximise the potential of this resource

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit of the motorway to unlimited
attributes.background: In Germany I realized how efficient and well maintained the highways were and how advanced the "Autobahns" are similar to the "smart" motorways we have in the UK. I believe we should have a system in place where in certain areas of the motorway it should have an unrestricted speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: 6% of deaths occur on British motorways and 40% in urban roads. a further 54% of deaths occur on rural roads. compared with Germany their motorway deaths stand at 12%, 60% on rural roads and 28% in urban areas. I believe we should use the same system where we can adjust the speed limit to the road conditions using the smart motorways (such as limiting the motorway to 70mph in wet conditions etc) and introducing unlimited speed limits in quiet times such as 9pm-8am. This would allow less accidents down rural roads as there is a safer place to speed (as shown by statistics)

attributes.action: Train operators should provide more rolling stock to give all commuters a seat
attributes.background: Train operators habitually operate trains with 4 carriages at peak times causing dangerous levels of overcrowding. Many at non-peak times have up to 12 nearly empty carriages.  They justify this to get rolling stock into position. If they were to invest in enough stock this wouldn't be necessary.
attributes.additional_details: This is self evident to thousands of commuters who use the trains everyday and put up with poor customer service. Part of the franchise should enforce investment in rolling stock to fully meet peak demand.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number on contact.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number when contacting people. This will give people the chance to call bar nuisance callers directly from home and hopefully bring a stop to the constantly ringing telephone and recorded messages.

attributes.action: Hygiene Facilities in Educational Institutes for our Children
attributes.background: As a grandmother, I struggle at times as my grandchild comes home with her underwear unclean and parents and carers like me would like our children coming home clean and it would be easier for measures to put in place for hygiene purposes.

attributes.action: Redistribute 8 Billion saving from EU to areas with the highest unemployment.
attributes.background: If, we are to leave the EU, and the amount saved is 8 billion pounds. This money should not be swallowed up by tax cuts. It should go to alleviating poverty, in the areas that need it most.

attributes.action: cap the price of household line rental to £10.00 a month.
attributes.background: over £200. per year in line rental charges by service providers, thats before any other charges are made,, it needs to be capped at £10.00.

attributes.action: Introduce better benefits for stay at home parents.
attributes.background: Child care is very expensive which means some parents decided to live off one wage and have a stay at home Mum or Dad for their child. I feel that there is not enough financial help from the government for stay at home parents.Sometimes the wage of one isn't enough.

attributes.action: Immediately raise the minimum wage by 10% to counteract the slump in the pound
attributes.background: People on minimum wage - especially those like myself aged between 18 and 21 - struggled to make ends meet as things were. With all imported products risen in price by 10% due to the slump in the pound, we need some support. We the undersigned call on the government to raise NMW by 10%.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the result of the EU referendum, the pound has dropped by more than 10% against the euro and dollar, increasing the price of all imported goods. It is forecast to drop further. This affects those on lower wages a considerable amount. As I am currently being paid £5.30 an hour, any increase in costs could make me unable to support myself. I fear that I may fall into debt and/or become a burden on the state - this is not something I would like to happen to myself or others in my position.

attributes.action: Change UK Prostitution Laws to be in line with Norway, Sweden, Ireland, France.
attributes.background: The laws around prostitution in the UK are inefficient. Decriminalisation zones are proven to be ineffective, as demonstrated by the murder of Daria Pionko that took place in Leeds, December 2015. Laws around prostitution are in urgent need of reform to ensure this industry doesn't continue to grow.
attributes.additional_details:
Signatories recommend:
- The prostituted be absolved of all criminality
- Investment is made in supporting prostituted persons to exit the sex trade via specialised training, support & health services
- Those at risk of entering prostitution are identified & supported to ensure they have viable career & education options
- The purchase of sexual access to human bodies is criminalised & subject to custodial penalty
- Consultation with Survivor Organisations is undertaken to inform legislation

attributes.action: British summer time should take effect at 4pm on a weekday
attributes.background: It is depressing losing an hours sleep and by changing it to an afternoon it would cheer everyone up, boosting public morale.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 and invest in a future looking transport system
attributes.background:
HS2 is investment in 19th century technology when we need to once again lead the world with a future looking transport system.

Focus the investment on autonomous vehicles, road trains, drones, self driving cars, even hyperloop.  

HS2 is out of date before it is even built.
attributes.additional_details:
Hyperloop already shown to be cheaper then high speed rail.
https://www.engadget.com/2016/07/06/hyperloop-one-proves-its-cheaper-than-high-speed-rail/

Cross Europe Driverless lorries already tested
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/apr/07/convoy-self-driving-trucks-completes-first-european-cross-border-trip

Road trains to be tested this year in the UK
http://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/industry/autonomous-lorries-be-tested-uk-motorways-year

attributes.action: Make it illegal to conduct racially insulting political campaign
attributes.background: It has become very common for politicians running for offices and campaigns lying and run racially insulting campaigns. Request the parliament to make it illegal to run such campaigns filled with lies and racial hatred
attributes.additional_details: The European Union referendum and the following Leaders elections have become very dirty. Many times the opponents blaming wrongly each other supporting certain religions. Using religion hatred is illegal in UK already, but no one is questioning the politicians when they are inciting the racial hatred. Request the parliamentarians to discuss this in the parliament and make laws to make racially motivated smear campaigns as illegal.

attributes.action: War and bombing a country or people must be the last option, not the first.
attributes.background:
The Chilcot report has now made it clear "the UK chose to join the invasion of Iraq"  and "Military action at that time was not a last resort".
 
A step by step process should be adopted and implemented before the country goes to war with a country or a people.
attributes.additional_details:
A law should be introduced that ensures that before any violent engagement all other options are exhausted.

A rushed decision should not be made just to silent the public due to an incident or tragic event but rather full procedures should always be followed and the aftermath of the engagement should be given great consideration. 

A vote in the parliament is not enough and can not justify the loss of millions of lives especially when it is apparent like in the Chilcot report that the UK led by Tony Blair was rushed, mislead and ill-prepared for the aftermath. There must be more public involvement in such  decision making. Full responsibility must be put on the Prime Minster of the time.

attributes.action: Re-commit £1 billion in funding for carbon capture and storage (CCS) technology.
attributes.background: Carbon capture and storage (CCS) takes the CO2 produced by power plants and locks it safely away underground. We need Government investment in this technology if the UK is to have any hope of meeting the carbon targets agreed in Paris 2015 and effectively fighting climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government has been promising support for CCS since 2007, and in 2012 opened a commercialization "competition" offering £1 billion in venture capital. The funding was withdrawn in November 2015. 

The latest carbon budget will not enable us to meet Paris targets, but CCS can close the gap. The Energy and Climate Change committee and Oxford climate scientist Dr Myles Allen both recommend the Government develop a clear strategy for development of CCS infrastructure and expertise in the UK.

attributes.action: Reduce basic VAT rate to 15%, with further reduction after we have left the EU
attributes.background:
The 'Leave' camp pointed out that the EU sets minimums for VAT rates. The EU basic rate is a minimum of 15% but the UK is currently higher than this, at 20%.

We can't lower it below 15% until we leave the EU, but we *can* lower it to 15%, and then lower it more after we leave the EU
attributes.additional_details:
When the Leave campaign said that while in the EU, we would be unable to control our VAT rates. This is accurate, the EU sets minimums for different categories.

At the moment, we are still in the EU, so have to abide by those rules. 

However, the basic rate of VAT in the UK is currently 20%. This is 5% more than the EU's minimum basic rate of 15% - meaning that we have control over that 5%. Let's get rid of that 5% that we *do* have control of, and once we have left the EU, reduce it further!

attributes.action: STOP the closure of another A&E department in the North East...
attributes.background: Proposals would see A&E departments across Teesside, Durham and Darlington reduced from four to three; putting additional pressure on existing services.  Contradicting the Government’s pledge to ‘improve the health of the country’ and 'making services easier for patients to access'.
attributes.additional_details: The loss of local A&E Services in Hartlepool in 2011, has already caused unnecessary hardship and inconvenience for patients who now travel to Stockton to access A&E.  The road infrastructure (A19 / A66) is inadequate; causing delays for ambulances and patients, potentially causing unnecessary deaths.  The remaining four A&E Departments serve Hartlepool, Stockton, Middlesbrough, Redcar & Cleveland and Darlington, with a total population of 662,800 (2011 Census).

attributes.action: Accept & publish on website all Petitions associated with UK EU referendum
attributes.background:
Little debate in parliament regarding all the implications of the UK leaving EU prior 23 June 2016 Referendum

UK petition website should accept all submitted petitions regardless of whether assessor assumes similar to another petition. Exiting EU is highly complex all petitions require debate.
attributes.additional_details:
Citizens should have been aware of positives & negatives of UK leaving EU prior voting

Petition assessor rejected "Agree in leaving the EU, negotiate continued Free Movement for All UK citizens."
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/157571
Petition rejected grounds claiming similar to another petition  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/135700

All EU referendum petitions need open debate. Simply rejecting petitions on assumption similar when issues highly complex is undemocratic.

attributes.action: No free bus passes,tv licences for people holding over 100k in account.
attributes.background: Not fair lot of millionaires in uk can afford it and they still get all these benefits.

attributes.action: Improve young voter turnout: polling stations in universities and colleges
attributes.background: Young voters are statistically proven to have a poorer turnout to elections than older voters, despite having to live longer with the results. In order to improve young voter turnout, improving accessibility to polling stations by putting them in educational institutions ought to be considered.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.economist.com/blogs/economist-explains/2014/10/economist-explains-24

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/28/young-people-bad-voting-millennials-eu-vote-politics

https://next.ft.com/content/1ce1a720-ce94-3c32-a689-8d2356388a1f

attributes.action: Start working on a drive through tunnel for the Isle of Wight to help the locals
attributes.background: A fixed link drive through tunnel will help the locals, businesses, tourism and the economy of the Island and stop the ferry companies over pricing  the poor and slow service plus it will create employment and boost the Island as a great holiday destination for many many years to come.

attributes.action: Call a general election or allow a vote on repealing the Communities Act 1972.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to either call a general election or ensure that there is a vote in parliament for repealing the European Communities Act 1972 before invoking Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
We feel that you owe the electorate and/or Parliament a choice given that :-

Scotland, Northern Ireland, Gibraltar, London and 75% of MPs all voted to remain.

The UK Leave majority was slim, so there is not a strong mandate to leave.

There is currently no leadership in either of the main parties.

There is a constitutional crisis which threatens the breakup of two Unions.

That the defacto leader of the Leave campaign will not stand as PM.

attributes.action: UK practical driving test time to be reduced.
attributes.background: 40 minutes for a driving test is a long time to sit in a car with an examiner looking at you throughout the test. Many people fail their test not because their bad drivers but because their nervous and sweaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Sitting in an exam is hard as it is, but sitting one in a car with an examiner next to guy watching at everything you do is another thing. I think the driving test time should be reduced to at least 20-30 minutes. 

Many people fail their test because their nervous and don't know what the examiner is writing, it puts the learner under a lot of stress and end up failing their tests. £62 is a lot of money to spend every time you fail and have to rebook a test. Reducing the time will be good.
